title: Welcome to My Site
text:
Feel free to explore my site to see my Final Year Project, my latest Data Visualization work, or my Reflection on the evolving role of AI in technology.
Hello! I am a dedicated student with a strong foundation in Computer Science and Applied Mathematics. I am passionate about bridging the gap between complex data analysis and practical software solutions.
I enjoy working on technical projects ranging from web development to data analysis.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
What GenAI tool did you use?
For this assessment, I used Gemini (specifically the Gemini 3 Flash model). I chose this tool because of its ability to provide real-time technical troubleshooting and its deep integration with programming workflows like RStudio and Git.


How the GenAI tool helped me
The tool was instrumental in several areas: 1. Troubleshooting Git Errors: When I encountered the fatal: no upstream branch error in my terminal, Gemini explained that my local master branch wasn‚Äôt linked to GitHub and provided the exact command (git push -u origin master) to fix it. 2. Quarto Configuration: It helped me structure my _quarto.yml file to ensure my navigation bar was correctly linked to my .qmd files. 3. Environment Setup: It provided guidance on moving my project out of OneDrive to prevent synchronization conflicts with Git‚Äôs internal tracking files.


Benefits of the Tool
The primary benefit was the speed of resolution. Instead of searching through long forum threads, I could provide my specific error message and get a tailored solution immediately. It acted as a ‚Äúthought partner‚Äù that helped bridge the gap between my knowledge of Java/JavaScript and the specific syntax of R and Quarto.


Challenges of the Tool
The main challenge was ensuring the AI understood my local folder structure. For example, I had to be very specific about file names (like logo.png vs fav-icon.png) to ensure the generated code snippets would work without ‚Äúbroken image‚Äù errors.


Future Assistance
In my future study and work, I see GenAI tools as essential for rapid prototyping. Whether I am debugging a MySQL connection in Python or setting up an AWS EMR cluster, having a tool that can explain complex documentation in simple steps will significantly increase my productivity.

title: Data Visualization
text:
Below is a scatter plot representing the relationship between weekly study hours and final exam scores for a sample of 50 students in a Statistics module.



Scatter Plot of Study Hours vs Exam Scores




This graph visualizes quantitative data. The x-axis represents the independent variable (Study Hours per Week), and the y-axis represents the dependent variable (Exam Scores, ranging from 0-100). Each point on the plot represents an individual student‚Äôs data.



This visualization was created as part of a probability and statistics project to determine if there was a strong positive correlation between time investment and academic results.
Rationale for the Visualization: I chose a Scatter Plot because it is the most effective way to identify the relationship (correlation) between two numerical variables. By adding a trend line, I could clearly show that as study hours increased, exam scores tended to rise, providing a visual representation of the \(r\) correlation coefficient we calculated in class.

title: FYP Project
text: This project involved using an Arduino, a moisture sensor, and a water pump to automate plant watering based on various monitoring statistics through sensors.

title: Welcome to My Site
text:
About Me
I am currently pursuing my studies with a focus on building robust, data-driven applications. My academic journey has been defined by a deep curiosity for how systems work‚Äîfrom the low-level logic of hardware to the high-level abstractions of web frameworks. I thrive in environments that challenge my problem-solving skills and allow me to apply theoretical concepts to real-world projects.








Noteüõ†Ô∏è My Strengths




Full-Stack Development: Experience in JavaScript, PHP, and Python (MySQL integration).
Systems & Infrastructure: Proficient with Linux servers, networking (STP/Subnetting), and AWS EMR clusters.
Hardware-Software Integration: Building automated systems with Arduino, sensors, and relays.
Mathematical Rigor: Strong background in Linear Algebra and Inferential Statistics.











Tipüí° Technical Interests




Data Visualization: Using R and Quarto to turn quantitative data into visual insights.
Game Development: Working with the LibGDX framework in Java.
Cloud & Big Data: Exploring scalable AWS solutions and NoSQL applications.
